page.title: 05The Frome Valley Walkway
page.content: The River Frome flows through our area and along its banks is the Frome Valley Walkway which stretches from Frenchay to Iron Acton. The name 'Frome' is derived from an old word meaning 'fast flowing'. Taking this attractive path you pass many historic sites including the remains of several old mills,though in many cases it is only the weirs that remain. The river runs under the Winterbourne Viaduct,a fine example of a Victorian railway bridge. It has eleven magnificent arches and is almost thirty metres above the river. Many people who use the walkway do so to exercise their dogs. They also go to enjoy the wildlife and peaceful atmosphere. Besides the locals, people from many other areas make use of this path. Sometimes people from other countries visit it whilst sight seeing.
